member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: Creates a new .

member.name: M:HtmlKit.HtmlEntityDecoder.Push(System.Char)
member.summary: Push the specified character into the HTML entity decoder.

remarks.para: Pushes the specified character into the HTML entity decoder.
The first character pushed MUST be the '&' character.

member.returns: true if the character was accepted; otherwise, false.
member.exception: is the first character being pushed and was not the '&' character.

member.name: M:HtmlKit.HtmlEntityDecoder.GetValue
member.remarks: Gets the decoded entity value.

member.name: M:HtmlKit.HtmlEntityDecoder.Reset
member.remarks: Resets the entity decoder.

member.remarks: Tokenizes HTML text, emitting an for each token it encounters.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: Creates a new .

member.name: P:HtmlKit.HtmlTokenizer.DecodeCharacterReferences
member.summary: Get or set whether or not the tokenizer should decode character references.

remarks.para: Gets or sets whether or not the tokenizer should decode character references.
Note: Character references in attribute values will still be decoded even if this value is set to false.

member.value: true if character references should be decoded; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:HtmlKit.HtmlTokenizer.HtmlNamespace
member.summary: Get the current HTML namespace detected by the tokenizer.
member.remarks: Gets the current HTML namespace detected by the tokenizer.

remarks.para: This property is most commonly used for error reporting, but can be called at any time. The starting value for this property is 1.
Combined with , a value of 1,1 indicates the start of the document.
This property is most commonly used for error reporting, but can be called at any time. The starting value for this property is 1.
Combined with , a value of 1,1 indicates the start of the document.

member.name: M:HtmlKit.HtmlWriter.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resource used by the object.
member.remarks: Call when you are finished using the . The method leaves the in an unusable state. After calling , you must release all references to the so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the was occupying.

member.name: T:HtmlKit.HtmlWriterState
member.summary: An enumeration of possible states of a .
member.remarks: An enumeration of possible states of a .

member.name: F:HtmlKit.HtmlWriterState.Default
member.summary: The is not within a tag. In this state, the can only write a tag or text.

member.name: F:HtmlKit.HtmlWriterState.Tag
member.summary: The is inside a tag but has not started to write an attribute. In this state, the can write an attribute, another tag, or text.

member.name: F:HtmlKit.HtmlWriterState.Attribute
member.summary: The is inside an attribute. In this state, the can append a value to the current attribute, start the next attribute, or write another tag or text.
